alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Pickens; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 30 at 12:28AM CST until November 30 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM CST FOR CENTRAL WALKER...TUSCALOOSA...EAST CENTRAL PICKENS AND SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 1227 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Smith Dam to 7 miles southeast of Boley Springs to near Gordo, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Tuscaloosa, Northport, Jasper, Sumiton, Cordova, Dora, Gordo, Carrollton, Holt, Brookwood, Parrish, Coker, Oakman, Sipsey, West Jefferson, Gorgas Steam Plant, Samantha, Lake Lurleen State Park, Tuscaloosa Amphitheater and Tuscaloosa Regional Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CST for central and west central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
